name: Grilled Lime Cilantro Chicken with Sweet Chili Sauce
description: Perfectly grilled tender and juicy chicken marinated in a lime cilantro marinade with soy sauce and topped with sweet chili sauce. Marinate the chicken the night before or the morning-of and you'll be ready for dinner in no time. This recipe was made in a Panasonic CIO.

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag. Combine 1/4 cup cilantro, lime juice, soy sauce, olive oil, and garlic in a small bowl. Pour over chicken and seal the bag. Let marinate in the refrigerator, 3 hours to overnight.
Preheat Panasonic® Countertop Induction Oven to Medium on the "Grill" setting.
Place chicken on the grill pan. Grill chicken for 6 to 7 minutes per side or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Brush chicken with sweet chili sauce. Garnish with 1 teaspoon cilantro.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Grilled Lime Cilantro Chicken with Sweet Chili Sauce

review.reviewBody: Fantastic recipe! I used chicken breast tenders and doubled the recipe to feed 4 people. I grilled the tenders for 6 minutes each side in my Panasonic CIO, and the temp was right at 165 degrees. They were moist, flavorful and so so good! I served this with Asian Coconut Rice (also from this site), and sauteed zucchini, carrots and onions. My husband kept saying "this is a do again!" Consider that high praise!

Really quick, easy and delicious! I followed the recipe exactly and we all enjoyed this. I made a side of roasted julliened carrots and green onions that I roasted on auto cook 4 with a little sesame oil. When they were done I tossed them with a mixture of soy sauce and sweet chili lime sauce and served it over couscous. Such a good dinner! I'll be making this again for sure!

Fabulous!  Two in the family were angry about the cilantro and lime in the marinade until they tasted the finished product.  The author was immediately forgiven and they asked for seconds.  The chicken was moist and tender and packed great flavor.  Served this with waffle fries and fresh fruit.  8 out of 8 thumbs up!
this has become a regular in our house!

Absolutely loved this recipe. The chicken was juicy and moist. Followed the recipe as given. Any leftovers were just as good cold the next day. The only suggestion would be to buy boneless skinless chicken breasts and cut them in half. This recipe is definitely a keeper

Made as written marinated overnight. Great grilled chicken recipe. I did not use the sweet chili sauce although i am sure it would have been delicioius. I sliced for salads and sandwich wraps for lunches. Will definately make again.

Excellent recipe from my friend Brian. Out of necessity I had to sub in dried cilantro and I sped up the marinate time by using a vacuum sealer marinate tray. The chicken was tender and flavorful and juicy!

I used chicken tenders and was intending to grill them on my BBQ but as things turned out (you know how families roll) I ran out of time and light and used stovetop. Still the chicken was flavorful and yummy. I marinated the chicken for about five hours or so before cooking and for small pieces of chicken that may have been just a touch too long. But still it was great! Thanks bd.weld!

5/31/2019 - This is our 2nd time making this recipe and now updating it from 4 stars to 5 stars as the flavors just meld together so perfectly! This recipe is so easy to whip together and delicious! The first time we made it the flavors didn t come through enough for us but my grill master thinks it was his fault on the charcoal grill 2 years ago as he was rushing (too much smokey type char flavor). Finally made this recipe again last night as I had cilantro to use up and was short on time. Followed exactly as written and it s a hit in this house! Squeezed a little lime on top of the chicken at the end after brushing on the sweet chili sauce makes this recipe even better. We served with arroz verde (leftovers) and grilled broccoli. Thanks for the recipe bd.weld!
